content.question:
Lewis Dot Diagram
Boiling Point <math alttext="In degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mpadded><mo>°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mpadded></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>

<math alttext="26" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mn>26</mn></math>

<math alttext="negative 196" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mn>196</mn></math>

Which of the following best helps to explain why the boiling point of <math alttext="H C N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>HCN</mi></math> is so much higher than that of <math alttext="N 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, as shown by the data in the table above?

choices.label: <math alttext="H C N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>HCN</mi></math> contains three atoms, whereas <math alttext="N 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> contains two atoms.

<math alttext="H C N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>HCN</mi></math> is polar, whereas <math alttext="N 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> is nonpolar.

<math alttext="H C N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>HCN</mi></math> has a molar entropy greater than that of <math alttext="N 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>.

The <math alttext="C, N triple" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo lspace="0.1em" rspace="0.1em">≡</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> bond is stronger than the <math alttext="N, N triple" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo lspace="0.1em" rspace="0.1em">≡</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> bond.

content.answer: <math alttext="H C N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>HCN</mi></math> is polar, whereas <math alttext="N 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> is nonpolar.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
